unnormalised: **Traffic Chaos Getting a Makeover? New Rules on the Horizon!**
normalised: Traffic Chaos Getting a Makeover? New Rules on the Horizon!

unnormalised: Bangalore, October 26 - Fed up with the city’s traffic? Well, there might be some relief coming your way! Word on the street (literally!) is that the Karnataka Transport Department is cooking up some new traffic regulations, hopefully before the Onam rush hits next year.
normalised: Bangalore, October twenty six - Fed up with the city’s traffic? Well, there might be some relief coming your way! Word on the street (literally!) is that the Karnataka Transport Department is cooking up some new traffic regulations, hopefully before the Onam rush hits next year.

unnormalised: Sources say the changes could include stricter enforcement of lane discipline, especially on Hosur Road. Imagine, no more haphazard weaving! They're also talking about hefty fines, potentially in the thousands of Rs., for repeat offenders blocking junctions and disrupting traffic flow near tech parks.
normalised: Sources say the changes could include stricter enforcement of lane discipline, especially on Hosur Road. Imagine, no more haphazard weaving! They're also talking about hefty fines, potentially in the thousands of rupees, for repeat offenders blocking junctions and disrupting traffic flow near tech parks.

unnormalised: Think those auto rickshaws zipping across three lanes will finally face some consequences? Let’s hope so!
normalised: Think those auto rickshaws zipping across three lanes will finally face some consequences? Let’s hope so!

unnormalised: Plus, rumours are swirling about designated "biryani delivery zones" in congested areas to avoid delivery riders adding to the already monumental traffic jams. Maybe a little less honking during lunch hour is in our future?
normalised: Plus, rumours are swirling about designated "biryani delivery zones" in congested areas to avoid delivery riders adding to the already monumental traffic jams. Maybe a little less honking during lunch hour is in our future?

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Road Safety is reportedly consulting on the changes, aiming to bring Bangalore’s roads closer to some semblance of order. Fingers crossed this actually translates to a smoother commute! Stay tuned for more updates as they develop.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Road Safety is reportedly consulting on the changes, aiming to bring Bangalore’s roads closer to some semblance of order. Fingers crossed this actually translates to a smoother commute! Stay tuned for more updates as they develop.
